    void
    loadData(String path)
    This method is used to load all the data from the file into a list called file data in this object in the format required for processing the data for creating the nodes of the tree to be searched for to get the required details.
    Customer
    searchCustomer(int customerId)
    This method searches the tree with the customer id and returns all the details of the customer such as products bought by that customer, customer full name and country where the customer resides.Also, the node with that customer details would be splayed to the top of the tree.
    An exception would be thrown if we search for the details without creating the tree.
    Order
    searchOrder(int orderId)
    This method searches the tree with the order id and returns all the products in that order, the total profit for the order, the total amount of that order, the total discount provided in that order, the status of that order and country to where that order was placed.Also, the node with that order details would be splayed to the top of the tree.

    • loadData

      public void loadData(String path)
      This method is used to load all the data from the file into a list called file data in this object in the format required for processing the data for creating the nodes of the tree to be searched for to get the required details.
      Specified by:
      loadData in interface TreeService
      Parameters:
      path - of the file to be loaded

    • createCustomerTree

      public void createCustomerTree()
      This method creates the tree with the customer details.
      Workflow of this method:
      1. The data is read from the raw data list(file data) in order.
      2. A record of the customer with the details is created, as we iterate through the file data.
      3. If the customer record already exists in the tree, the record is updated with the other products bought by the customer.
      4. If the customer record is not present in the tree, it will be added into the tree.
      Since we are creating a splay tree, the last record inserted into the tree will be splayed on to the top, if the customer record is already present in the tree then that record will be splayed onto the top of the tree.
      Specified by:
      createCustomerTree in interface TreeService

    • createOrderTree

      public void createOrderTree()
      This method creates the tree with the order details.
      Workflow of this method:
      1. The data is read from the raw data list(file data) in order.
      2. A record of the order with the details is created, as we iterate through the file data.
      3. If the order record already exists in the tree, the record is updated with the other products bought in the order.Also, the total amount of the order, total discount for the order, total profit of the order will be updated. We update this for every order as we have these details in the data for every item, so we calculate the overall numbers for the order as a whole.
      4. If the order record is not present in the tree, it will be added into the tree.
      Since we are creating a splay tree, the last record inserted into the tree will be splayed on to the top, if the order record is already present in the tree then that record will be splayed onto the top of the tree.
      Specified by:
      createOrderTree in interface TreeService

    • searchCustomer

      public Customer searchCustomer(int customerId) throws EmptyTreeException
      This method searches the tree with the customer id and returns all the details of the customer such as products bought by that customer, customer full name and country where the customer resides.Also, the node with that customer details would be splayed to the top of the tree.
      An exception would be thrown if we search for the details without creating the tree.
      Specified by:
      searchCustomer in interface TreeService
      Parameters:
      customerId - is the ID of the customer whose details are to be searched
      Throws:
      EmptyTreeException

    • searchOrder

      public Order searchOrder(int orderId) throws EmptyTreeException
      This method searches the tree with the order id and returns all the products in that order, the total profit for the order, the total amount of that order, the total discount provided in that order, the status of that order and country to where that order was placed.Also, the node with that order details would be splayed to the top of the tree.
      Specified by:
      searchOrder in interface TreeService
      Parameters:
      orderId - is the ID of the order whose details are to be searched
      Throws:
      EmptyTreeException
